site.title: Carmine Fantarella (Portfolio)
site.description: Carmine is a Software Developer and Game Programming Teacher. A list of his published work can be found here and under his business website Games Of Edan.

elements.innerHtml:
Carmine

Fantarella

PROGRAMMER ~ GAME Designer ~ TEACHER

ABOUT ME

I'm an experienced Australian software developer and enthusiastic programming teacher currently employed at AIE (Academy of Interactive Entertainment). I specialise in programming languages like C++, C#, using tools including Visual Studio, Unity and UE4. I've successfully deployed applications to online Stores including Steam. In the past, I've designed & developed standalone 3D Engines using open source libraries, developed client management software & created signal processing tools for data analysis. I have 20+ years of experience as a software developer with small teams and large organisations, and worked in industries including defence, security & games.
~ Preview ~
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

EDUCATION  /  CERTIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical and Electronic) with 1st Class Honours, University of Adelaide [ 1996 ]
  • Cert IV TAE40116 Training & Assessment [ 2019 ]
  • Unity Certified Programmer [ 2020 ]
  • Mental Health First Aider [ 2020 ]
  • VET Educators Supporting Students with Disability [ 2020 ]
  • Middle Manager Course, Alison Online [ 2021 ]
  • Principles of Management Course, Alison Online [ 2021 ]
  • Past member of ACS (Australian Computer Society) & IGDA (International Games Developer Association)

CONTACT

[Email] carmine@capricorn76.com

[Twitter] @CFantarella

[LinkedIn] carmine-fantarella-aus

Adelaide, Australia

<iframe width="450" height="253" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/H49wQVvwATM" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

<iframe width="450" height="253" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rlet3-oLJSk" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Game Programming Teacher and Tutor  [ AIE, 2018 - Present ]

  • Deliver programming coursework and tutoring to adult learners, specialising in C# & C++ languages
  • Use industry technologies including Visual Studio, Unity, UE4, VR, git
  •  Deliver training around all aspects of the software development lifecycle
  • Monitor and advise students on coursework, technical, industry and career matters
  • Implement new curriculum content and delivery methods
  • Collaborate with team members to deliver coursework
  • Maintain relationships with industry professionals
  • Deliver face-to-face & online training
  • Participate in career events including Open Days & Industry Experience Days

Independent Game Developer  [ GAMES OF EDAN,  2014 - Present ]

  • Design & develop C# applications in  Unity (e.g. ICEBOX:Speedgunner )
  • Design & develop C++ / Blueprints applications in UE4, (e.g. Smashtris )
  • Software Architect software systems using both Object Oriented & ECS principles
  • Apply innovative programming techniques, including procedural level generation & music, multi-threaded AI
  • Design & develop aesthetics, environments, characters, narratives, sound design for games
  • Collaborate with industry personnel including voice artists, testers and game designers

BUSINESS OWNER  [ CAPRICORN 76 PTY. LTD.,  2003 - Present ]

  • Architect & Develop custom applications using C++, Lua and Open Source libraries (e.g. Glint 3D Engine )
  • Develop website tools using HTML, CSS, Apache, PHP, mySQL and other technologies
  • Publish software to Steam & other online portals (e.g. ICEBOX: Speedgunner )
  • Research and obtain trademarks via IP Australia

Systems Software Engineer  [ INTELLIGENT SW DEV,  2009 - 2010 ]

  • Software Architect distributed software systems for Agent-Based Simulations
  • Develop and deploy simulations of complex human-centric behaviours for prediction and analysis
  • Apply C++, Lua programming languages to develop custom distributed software solutions
  • Apply version control technologies including git and cloud services

Software Contractor  [ BRITISH AEROSPACE,  2003 ]

  • Assist existing team on code redesigns & refactoring
  • Software Architect new modules for integration into existing codebase
  • Apply C++ programming languages to develop software solutions
  • Use software development technologies including Rational Rose products

Senior Software Engineer  [ tENIX,  2001 - 2003 ]

  • Develop Ground Surveillance Radar training system in software team
  • Software Architect networking solutions using socket libraries
  • Apply C++ programming languages to develop software solutions
  • Participate in all aspects of software lifecycle, including code reviews, implementation, software testing

Professional Officer  [ DSTO,  1997 - 2001 ]

  • Conduct ISAR (Inverse Synthetic Aperture Radar) Signal Processing research & development
  • Develop multi-threaded, data-centric software to facilitate Data Collection and Analysis
  • Apply C++ programming languages to develop software solutions.
  • Publish research papers (e.g. ISARLAB signal processing software)
